name: Rename for the Web
body:
## What it does
Inspired by the Save for Web naming convention in Photoshop, right-click on the name of a file in Windows Explorer and select "Rename for the Web". Spaces in the filename will be replaced with hyphens.



## Installation

1. Unpack the .zip file to `C:\Program Files\webname`

2. To add the right-click item to your context menu, Start->Run and type **regedit**

3. Under the path `\HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\*\shell`, create a new key named **Rename for Web**

4. Create a subkey named **command**. 

5. The value of the subkey should be `C:\Program Files\webname\webname.exe "%1"`



## To do
* Make an installer to do the registry editing

tagline: Remove spaces from a file name in Windows Explorer
